question.questionA: Corolla with spreading lobes, very much longer than the short tube.
question.questionB: Corolla tubular, campanulate or conical, lobes usually shorter than the tube.

question.questionA: Anthers projecting forwards into a cone surrounding the style.
question.questionB: Anthers not forming a cone around the style.
Annual or perennial herbs, sometimes with a woody base.

question.questionA: Spiny shrubs with stellate hairs; leaves pinnatifid.
Calyx non-spiny; fruits c. 1 cm long, scarlet when ripe.
question.questionB: Calyx spiny; fruits 5-30 cm long, purple, white or yellow.

question.questionA: Plants with underground stoloniferous tubers; leaves pinnate; fruit globular, green.
question.questionB: Plants without underground tubers; leaves simple, entire or lobed.

question.questionA: Leaves entire or shallowly lobed; fruits black, occasionally green or yellow.
question.questionB: Leaves deeply lobed; fruits orange or brownish yellow.

question.questionA: Flowers dull purple; stamens usually exserted.
question.questionB: Flowers yellow or white; stamens not exserted.

question.questionA: Plants grey, stellate-tomentose; flowers in clusters of four to six.
question.questionB: Plants glabrous or sparsely hairy; flowers usually solitary.
